custom: Tipping is not expected in restaurants.
People clap when a plane lands safely.
Whistling indoors is considered bad luck.
Using both hands when giving or receiving something is a sign of respect.
People take their shoes off before entering a home.
It is customary to bring bread and salt as a housewarming gift.
A baby’s first haircut is often saved as a keepsake.
Christmas presents are opened on Christmas Eve, not Christmas Day.
Children leave their shoes out for treats on St. Nicholas Day.
Slurping noodles is considered polite.
The birthday person pays for their own party.
Spitting is considered a way to ward off bad luck.
People wear red underwear on New Year’s Eve for good luck.
Never give an even number of flowers as a gift.
Handshakes should be firm and eye contact is important.
Bread is never placed upside down on the table.
Throwing old furniture out the window on New Year's Eve is common.
When greeting, a kiss on both cheeks is common.
People eat 12 grapes at midnight on New Year's Eve for good luck.
Shoes should not be placed on the table.
Guests should bring a small gift when visiting someone's home.
People light sky lanterns for good luck.
Cutting a baby's hair before their first birthday is considered bad luck.
Pointing with the index finger is considered rude.
Wearing yellow on New Year's Eve attracts wealth.
Newborn babies are given a silver spoon for good fortune.
Sitting at the corner of a table means you may never get married.
Giving knives as gifts is believed to sever relationships.
The groom's shoes are often stolen during weddings.
People walk barefoot during religious ceremonies.
Nodding means 'no' and shaking the head means 'yes'.
Whistling at night attracts bad spirits.
It's common to drink from a shared gourd of mate.
Children throw baby teeth onto the roof for good luck.
The oldest person at the table should start eating first.
People pour water behind travelers for good luck.
People avoid shaking hands across a doorway.
Sweeping someone's feet means they may never get married.
Burping after a meal is seen as a compliment to the chef.
The number four is considered unlucky.
Standing chopsticks in rice is bad luck.
A thumb between the index and middle finger wards off the evil eye.
Married women wear black on their wedding day.
Brides wear crowns made of silver and gold.
Opening an umbrella indoors is bad luck.
Throwing coins into fountains brings good luck.
The first guest at a New Year's gathering should be a dark-haired man.
Women wear corsets as a cultural tradition.
People must never toast with water.
Brides hide pennies in their shoes for good luck.
